summary:
## Monarch Butterflies: A Colorful Journey

Monarch butterflies are famous North American insects known for their bright orange and black wings. They're often seen in North America, Europe, and Asia. Something amazing happens each year: millions migrate thousands of miles from Canada and the United States to Mexico for winter. In spring, their great-grandchildren fly back north! Not all monarchs migrate; some stay in warmer places year-round. They're important pollinators, but not the best at spreading milkweed pollen.
title: Monarch butterfly
